titles.title: To provide that Federal employees may retain for personal use promotional items received as a result of travel taken in the course of employment.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Mrs. Morella moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2456.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services.

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

committee.subcommittee: International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services
committee.name: Senate Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: 7/30/2001--Passed House without amendment. Allows Federal employees to retain promotional items (including frequent flyer miles, upgrades, and access to carrier clubs or facilities) received as a result of using travel or transportation services procured by the United States or accepted from non-Federal sources for travel and related expenses in the course of employment, if such items are obtained under the same terms as those offered to the public and at no additional cost to the Government.Repeals provisions under the Federal Acquisition Streamlining Act of 1994 regarding the issuance of guidelines for the use of frequent traveler programs by employees who engage in official air travel for the purpose of realizing cost savings for official travel.
